pullrequest.title: Minor fixes to allow Gazebo to compile on Windows and work with Windows paths.

content.raw: I think we all would have in fact preferred keeping them separate, so they could be reviewed more quickly. For instance, these changed are easily agreed upon so we could have less diff to argue about. I guess don't bother with it now, but in the future keeping changes small makes it more likely they will be merged
content.html: I think we all would have in fact preferred keeping them separate, so they could be reviewed more quickly. For instance, these changed are easily agreed upon so we could have less diff to argue about. I guess don't bother with it now, but in the future keeping changes small makes it more likely they will be merged

content.raw: I closed it as the changes are included in #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2344/config-and-cmake-fixes-for-windows-build/diff. That pull request includes fixes needed to be able to build on Windows AND run Gazebo on Windows so it seems sensible to combine.
content.html: I closed it as the changes are included in #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2344/config-and-cmake-fixes-for-windows-build/diff. That pull request includes fixes needed to be able to build on Windows AND run Gazebo on Windows so it seems sensible to combine.

pull_request.title: Minor fixes to allow Gazebo to compile on Windows and work with Windows paths.

update.description: Added preprocessor directive to use ';' for path separator on Windows. Removed some no longer required Win32 checks from Ogre calls.
update.title: Minor fixes to allow Gazebo to compile on Windows and work with Windows paths.
update.reason: Changes in this pull request are now in broader request #2344. I couldn't see how to delete a request so hopefully this decline does the same thing.

content.raw: Yeah the other thing I do is change the VC++ compiler option in the gazebo makefiles from -WAll to -w to get rid of those warnings. Personally I doubt the warnings about data conversions in the WIndows standard library headers are helping anybody much.
content.html: Yeah the other thing I do is change the VC++ compiler option in the gazebo makefiles from -WAll to -w to get rid of those warnings. Personally I doubt the warnings about data conversions in the WIndows standard library headers are helping anybody much.

content.raw: From my build tests with gazebo on Windows there's more broken than just ign-transport missing. Some of the cmake scripts also need to be updated. Once I understand what I'm doing and if they are still needed I'll submit some patches for the scripts.
content.html: From my build tests with gazebo on Windows there's more broken than just ign-transport missing. Some of the cmake scripts also need to be updated. Once I understand what I'm doing and if they are still needed I'll submit some patches for the scripts.

pullrequest.title: Minor fixes to allow Gazebo to compile on Windows and work with Windows paths.

content.raw:
It looks like there's conflicts. Do you know need assistance with resolving them?

The following commands may be relevant:

~~~
hg pull #!/osrf/gazebo -b default
hg up default
hg merge
~~~

It will then complain and ask to resolve conflicting files. You can edit them and then save and commit.
content.html:
It looks like there's conflicts. Do you know need assistance with resolving them?

The following commands may be relevant:

hg pull #!/osrf/gazebo -b default
hg up default
hg merge

It will then complain and ask to resolve conflicting files. You can edit them and then save and commit.
